Legal_Issue: Whether the Citizenship Judge erred in finding the Applicant failed to meet residency requirements under paragraph 5(1)(c) of the Citizenship Act
Application_Facts: Applicant must demonstrate at least 1,095 days of physical presence in Canada during the four years preceding the application
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the Citizenship Judge's decision
Court_Ruling: The decision was reasonable and based on thorough analysis of the evidence
Defendant_Behavior: Provided incomplete and inconsistent declarations regarding absences from Canada
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged error by Citizenship Judge in assessing residency compliance
Legal_Standard: Reasonableness standard applied to administrative decision
Assessment_Factor: Credibility and completeness of evidence regarding physical presence in Canada
Procedural_Issue: Judicial review before the Federal Court
Credibility_Assessment: Evidence deemed lacking in credibility due to inconsistencies
Evidence_Used: Applicant's declarations, records of absences from Canada
Application_Basis: Failure to prove 1,095 days of physical presence in Canada
Evidence_Assessed: Declarations and supporting documentation on residency
Relief_Sought: Overturning of the Citizenship Judgeâ€™s negative decision on residency
Governing_Rule: Applicants must have 1,095 days of physical presence in Canada within four years prior to application
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Incomplete and inconsistent evidence provided by applicant
Outcome: Application for judicial review dismissed; original decision upheld
Harm_Assessment: No harm established; decision found to be reasonable
Cause_Description: Applicant's failure to provide clear and credible evidence of meeting residency requirements
Evidence_Handling: Evidence scrutinized for consistency and reliability
Evidence_Issues: Discrepancies in declarations and lack of corroborating evidence
Residency_Compliance: Not satisfied due to insufficient proof of physical presence
Misrepresentation_Element: Potential misrepresentation through inaccurate or incomplete disclosure of absences
Jurisdictional_Issue: Federal Court jurisdiction over judicial review of citizenship decisions
Evidence_Assessment: Critical evaluation of applicant's evidence on residency
Decision_Rationale: Decision was reasonable based on the record and credibility concerns
Decision_Making_Body: Citizenship Judge, reviewed by Federal Court
Evidentiary_Issues: Inconsistencies and gaps in evidence regarding time spent in Canada
